The object around which the search will happen.;The shape we are looking for. Can be SHAPE_ANY = -359 to match any shape.;The maximum distance from 'obj' that will be considered in the search.

The object or location to be searched. Can be a container or NPC, a (x, y, z) location, PARTY = -357 to search the whole party or FIND_ON_SCREEN = -359 to search a square region around the screen location with size given by the screen's height.;The shape we are looking for.;The quality that is being sought. Can be QUALITY_ANY = -359 to match any quality.;What frame is desired. Can be FRAME_ANY = -359 to match any frame.

The shape in 'SHAPES.VGA' of the new object. If this is a monster shape, the object is created without any equipment whatsoever, even if the shape has an associated equipment entry.

If this is not the avatar, nothing happens. Otherwise, the party is teleported to the stored position.;This optional parameter controls whether avatar or party members that are paralyzed or asleep are teleported; if true, these members will be teleported, otherwise, they won't; defaults to false.

The bed where the avatar should sleep. This bed should be unoccupied.
Number of game ticks that should be advanced; 25 ticks are equal to one game minute, and 1500 ticks are equal to one game hour.
How long the effect should last. The actual duration, in seconds, is equal to one fourth of this value.
Numeric value indicating what the weather should be. Can be any of the values returned by UI_get_weather intrinsic.

What we want to set the return of the next the next 'UI_click_on_item' intrinsic' call to. Can be an object reference, a location (2 or 3 coordinates) or even the return of another 'UI_click_on_item' intrinsic' call.

The lowest number allowed.;The highest number allowed.;The distance between any two consecutive numbers that can be chosen.;The initial value selected; this value is forced to conform to the boundaries specified above.
